result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:08 PM Attorney Drew Lehman in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brandon J Ocampo in court.  Attorney Mary Cole in court for Brandon J Ocampo. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. Discussion held on the status of this matter and what the Court should schedule next.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

02:20 PM  State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman. Defendant, Brandon J Ocampo, appeared with Attorney Mary Cole.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Attorney Cole advises the Court that she just received an offer from the State. Both parties are requeseting an adjournment. Court adjourns.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant, Brandon J Ocampo, appeared with Attorney Mary Cole.  Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:50 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

01:13 PM    Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Patrick Brady.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Preliminary Hearing set on May 31, 2022 at 09:00 am. before Comm , 927-54th Street, Room 157, Kenosha, WI.  ts

Defendant, Brandon J Ocampo, appeared.  Attorney Drew Lehman appeared for the Prosecution. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
